attributes.action: request that the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square be used for a national memorial to Alan Turing.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has said he is wrong sorry for the treatment of Alan Turing. Sometimes words must be followed up with actions. It would be fitting for Alan Turing to be given the honour of a statue in Trafalgar Square to show that the nation values the work he and others did at Bletchley Park in shortening WWII and that being gay is no longer an issue in this country.

rejection.details: The fourth plinth at Trafalgar Square is a matter for the Mayor of London.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
